main event: A circular object was observed in the sky over San Antonio, Texas on August 12, 1952, by a witness during their night shift.
interesting points: The object was circular, appearing to be 30-40 feet in size., It was observed at an altitude of 500-1000 feet and moved in a straight course at high speed., The object emitted a bright light, much brighter than the stars, and had a steady brightness., The witness estimated the object appeared about 3,000 to 3,500 yards away., After approximately 30-45 minutes, the object moved slowly to the south before rapidly disappearing from sight.
sighted object: a bright circular light in the sky
witness description: The witness was working a night shift and described the object as bright and much larger than conventional aircraft.
